sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: New Joint Initiative to Tackle Core Identity Challenge For The Global Precious Metals Industry
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC, FinGo, and Bougainville Refinery Ltd (BRL) have launched a joint initiative to evaluate a combined technology framework for authenticating the gold supply chain. This collaboration aims to establish Bougainville as a global reference for transparent and responsible gold trade by integrating molecular-level gold authentication with biometric digital identity and KYC/AML infrastructure. The goal is to enhance end-to-end provenance, align with international standards, and reduce reliance on manual verification processes, serving as a potential benchmark for responsible gold trade worldwide.

feed.title: New Joint Initiative to Tackle Core Identity Challenge For The Global Precious Metals Industry
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC, FinGo, and Bougainville Refinery Ltd (BRL) have launched a joint initiative to address authentication and digital identity challenges in the global gold supply chain. This collaboration aims to establish Bougainville as a reference point for transparent, responsible, and technology-enabled gold trade by integrating material-level authentication, biometric digital identity, and BRL's operational expertise. The initiative is designed to enhance end-to-end provenance, align with international compliance standards, and reduce reliance on manual verification processes, setting a new benchmark for responsible gold trade globally.

feed.title: SMX Announces $111.5M Equity Purchase Agreement with Target Capital 1, LLC
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC has entered into an equity purchase agreement with Target Capital 1, LLC for $111.5 million. This agreement provides flexible funding, including a $11.5 million convertible promissory note and the right for SMX to sell up to $100 million in ordinary shares. A portion of the net proceeds will be used to acquire bitcoin or another cryptocurrency as a reserve asset.

feed.title: Cotton Just Became a Digital Asset, and SMX Is Building its Market Where Proof Sets the Price
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) has successfully proven that recycled cotton can be marked at a molecular level, allowing its identity to persist through the entire value chain. This innovation transforms cotton from a commodity into a data-rich digital asset with verifiable origin and composition. By integrating this molecular identity with its existing economic reward system for verified materials, SMX is creating a market where transparent, traceable, and sustainably sourced cotton can be premium priced and traded as a digital commodity.

feed.title: SMX Demonstrates End-to-End Breakthrough in Cotton Traceability: Proves Ability to Verify Origin and Recycled Content from Mechanical Recycling Through Yarn Spinning and Finished Fabric
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC announced a successful industrial pilot validating its full-chain traceability for cotton, from mechanical recycling through to finished fabric. The technology uses molecular markers to verify material origin and the percentage of recycled cotton, integrating with existing textile operations. This breakthrough aims to help brands, regulators, and manufacturers meet ESG requirements, secure preferential trade treatment, and enhance compliance for Digital Product Passports.

feed.title: SMX Announces Amendment to $111.5M Equity Purchase Agreement - Worcester Telegram & Gazette
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC has amended its equity purchase agreement, increasing the facility by an additional $5 million through a new convertible promissory note, bringing total potential proceeds to $116.5 million. The amendment also removes SMX's obligation to acquire cryptocurrency with a portion of the proceeds, provided its ordinary shares close above $10/share. The new convertible note is expected to close by the end of 2025, subject to customary conditions.

feed.title: SMX Keeps Adding Mileage to Its Molecular Empire, and Cotton Is the Latest Proof That the Deal-Making Bonanza Is Real
feed.summary: SMX (NASDAQ: SMX) is expanding its molecular identity network to include cotton, demonstrating its ability to span various material classes. This latest achievement, following successful implementations in plastics, metals, and rubber, strengthens SMX's position as a critical verification layer for the physical world. The company is generating a network effect where each new material added enhances the value of the entire system, leading to a "deal-making bonanza" as industries seek its compliance and credibility solutions.

feed.title: SMX Demonstrates End-to-End Breakthrough in Cotton Traceability: Proves Ability to Verify Origin and Recycled Content from Mechanical Recycling Through Yarn Spinning and Finished Fabric
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC announced a successful industrial pilot validating its ability to provide full-chain traceability for cotton. The company's molecular markers, applied during mechanical recycling, remained detectable and stable through the entire production process from fibre mixing to finished textile, enabling verification of material origin and recycled content. This breakthrough addresses critical challenges in apparel supply chains, supporting sustainability claims, trade compliance, and Digital Product Passport requirements.

feed.title: SMX Demonstrates End-to-End Breakthrough in Cotton Traceability: Proves Ability to Verify Origin and Recycled Content from Mechanical Recycling Through Yarn Spinning and Finished Fabric
feed.summary: SMX has announced a successful industrial pilot validating its full-chain traceability for cotton, confirming its molecular markers remain detectable through all stages of textile production from mechanical recycling to finished fabric. This breakthrough enables verifiable authentication of material origin and recycled content, addressing significant challenges in global apparel supply chains. The technology integrates with existing textile operations and offers a reliable way to meet ESG and Digital Product Passport requirements, positioning SMX for commercial deployment with leading brands.

feed.title: SMX Demonstrates End-to-End Breakthrough in Cotton Traceability: Proves Ability to Verify Origin and Recycled Content from Mechanical Recycling Through Yarn Spinning and Finished Fabric
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC announced a successful industrial pilot validating its full-chain traceability for cotton, demonstrating that its molecular markers can verify both material origin and recycled content from mechanical recycling through to finished fabric. This breakthrough allows for the authentication of cotton throughout its transformation journey, integrating with existing textile operations to provide a scalable mechanism for verifying recycled content. The technology enables brands and manufacturers to meet ESG and Digital Product Passport requirements, secure preferential tariff treatments, and strengthen export competitiveness.

feed.title: SMX Demonstrates End-to-End Breakthrough in Cotton Traceability: Proves Ability to Verify Origin and Recycled Content from Mechanical Recycling Through Yarn Spinning and Finished Fabric
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC announced a successful industrial pilot demonstrating full-chain traceability for cotton using molecular markers. These markers, applied during mechanical recycling, remained detectable through all stages of textile production, from yarn spinning to finished fabric. This breakthrough provides a scientific method to authenticate both material origin and recycled cotton content, helping brands meet ESG and Digital Product Passport requirements.

feed.title: SMX Demonstrates End-to-End Breakthrough in Cotton Traceability: Proves Ability to Verify Origin and Recycled Content from Mechanical Recycling Through Yarn Spinning and Finished Fabric
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC announced a successful industrial pilot demonstrating full-chain traceability for cotton, from mechanical recycling through finished fabric. Their molecular markers allow verification of material origin and recycled content, addressing significant challenges in apparel supply chains. This breakthrough offers a scientific method for sustainability claims, trade compliance, and meeting Digital Product Passport requirements.

feed.title: SMX Demonstrates End-to-End Breakthrough in Cotton Traceability: Proves Ability to Verify Origin and Recycled Content from Mechanical Recycling Through Yarn Spinning and Finished Fabric
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC announced a successful industrial pilot demonstrating full-chain traceability for cotton using molecular markers. These markers, applied during mechanical recycling, remained detectable through all textile production stages, allowing for verifiable authentication of material origin and recycled content. This breakthrough establishes a new standard for evidence-based sustainability, trade compliance, and digital product passports in the textile sector.

feed.title: Goldstrom Partners with SMX to Deliver End-to-End Traceability and Circularity in Precious Metals
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC, a leader in molecular-marker technology and blockchain-backed digital product passports, has partnered with Goldstrom Advisory FZCO, an expert in global physical precious metals. This Advisory Agreement aims to integrate SMX's patented molecular-marking and tracking technology into the precious metals supply chain, enabling full audit-grade transparency, provenance, and sustainability. The collaboration will also support circularity through SMX's trueGold™ and trueSilver™ subsidiaries, allowing for verifiable recycling streams where reclaimed metals retain their certified identity.

feed.title: SMX Announces Amendment to $111.5M Equity Purchase Agreement
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC announced an amendment to its standby equity purchase agreement, increasing the facility by an additional $5 million, bringing total proceeds up to $116.5 million. The amendment also removes SMX's obligation to acquire cryptocurrency with a portion of the proceeds, provided its ordinary shares close above $10/share. The investors will purchase a new convertible promissory note for $5.0 million from SMX, with the closing expected before the end of 2025.

feed.title: Goldstrom Partners with SMX to Deliver End-to-End Traceability and Circularity in Precious Metals
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC has partnered with Goldstrom Advisory FZCO to enhance traceability and circularity in the precious metals industry. Goldstrom will assist SMX in developing products for the gold and silver supply chain, integrating SMX’s molecular-marking and blockchain technology for full audit-grade transparency, provenance, and sustainability. This collaboration aims to create a trusted digital foundation where precious metals have a verified journey and reinforced integrity.

feed.title: SMX (Security Matters) Stock Is Trending: What's Going On?
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC (NASDAQ: SMX) shares are experiencing a significant crash, trading down roughly 50% after a massive momentum run. This extreme volatility is linked to the company's 1-for-8 reverse stock split, which drastically reduced its float and is now exacerbating the sell-off due to a lack of liquidity. Benzinga Edge technical indicators show a mixed outlook, with a positive short and medium-term trend but a negative long-term one.

feed.title: SMX Announces Amendment to $111.5M Equity Purchase Agreement
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC has amended its standby equity purchase agreement, increasing the facility by an additional $5 million, bringing the total to $116.5 million. The amendment also removes SMX's obligation to acquire cryptocurrency if its ordinary shares close above $10/share. The new convertible promissory note sale is expected to close by the end of 2025.

feed.title: SMX Announces $111.5M Equity Purchase Agreement with Target Capital 1, LLC
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC has entered into an equity purchase agreement with Target Capital 1, LLC for $111.5 million. This funding will support SMX's business development, with a portion allocated to acquiring Bitcoin or other cryptocurrencies as a reserve asset. The agreement includes a $11.5 million convertible promissory note and an equity line of credit allowing SMX to sell up to $100 million in ordinary shares at its discretion.

feed.title: Goldstrom Partners with SMX to Deliver End-to-End Traceability and Circularity in Precious Metals
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC has partnered with Goldstrom Advisory FZCO to bring its molecular-marker technology and blockchain-backed digital product passports to the global precious metals supply chain. This collaboration aims to provide end-to-end traceability, provenance, and sustainability for gold and silver, enhancing compliance and ESG standards for clients from mining to recycling. The partnership will integrate SMX's technology into Goldstrom's advisory framework, enabling verified "memory-enabled" supply chains for precious metals.

feed.title: SoFi Technologies, Oklo, Meta, Ulta Beauty and BigBear.ai: Why These 5 Stocks Are On Investors' Radars Today
feed.summary: Major U.S. indices closed mixed on Thursday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average slipping 0.07%, the S&P 500 edging up 0.1%, and the Nasdaq adding 0.2%. This article highlights five stocks that captured the attention of retail traders and investors: SoFi Technologies (SOFI), Oklo (OKLO), Meta Platforms (META), Ulta Beauty (ULTA), and BigBear.ai (BBAI), detailing their recent stock performance and underlying news.

feed.title: Goldstrom Partners with SMX to Deliver End-to-End Traceability and Circularity in Precious Metals
feed.summary: Goldstrom Advisory FZCO has partnered with SMX (Security Matters) PLC to integrate SMX's molecular-marker technology and blockchain-backed digital product passports into the gold and silver supply chain. This collaboration aims to provide audit-grade transparency, provenance, and sustainability for clients in mining, refining, and trading through advisory services and the use of SMX's trueGold™ and trueSilver™ platforms. The partnership seeks to transform the precious metals industry by enabling verifiable, high-integrity recycling streams and enhancing compliance with ESG demands.

feed.title: Goldstrom Partners with SMX to Deliver End-to-End Traceability and Circularity in Precious Metals
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC has partnered with Goldstrom Advisory FZCO to enhance traceability and circularity in the precious metals industry. This collaboration aims to integrate SMX’s molecular marking and blockchain technology with Goldstrom’s advisory services, enabling full audit-grade transparency, provenance, and sustainability for clients. The partnership will focus on transforming the precious-metals ecosystem through advisory integration, operational application of molecular markers, and circularity enablement via SMX subsidiaries trueGold™ and trueSilver™.

feed.title: SMX Is Exploding: Here's Why This Tech Stock Is Up Over 1,000% This Week
feed.summary: Shares of SMX (Security Matters) PLC (NASDAQ: SMX) are experiencing a historic rally, surging over 1,000% in the last five days. This explosion in stock price is attributed to the company's recent press releases highlighting its technology for global trade security, its presentation at a Dubai conference, and a strategic partnership in Europe. Investors are now actively trading SMX, betting on its potential to digitize physical assets and improve supply chain transparency.

feed.title: Security Matters (SMX) Shares Jump Over 48% After Hours: What's Going On?
feed.summary: Shares of Security Matters (SMX) surged over 48% in after-hours trading following the company's presentation of its molecular identity technology at the DMCC Precious Metals Conference in Dubai. This technology embeds invisible molecular markers into materials for authenticated tracking, replacing traditional paper-based methods. SMX has also secured six strategic partnerships to deploy this technology globally.

feed.title: SMX Announces $111.5M Equity Purchase Agreement with Target Capital 1, LLC
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC has entered into an equity purchase agreement with Target Capital 1, LLC for $111.5 million. This agreement provides a flexible funding source, including a $11.5 million convertible promissory note and an equity line of credit for up to $100 million in ordinary shares. A portion of the proceeds will be used to acquire bitcoin or another cryptocurrency as a reserve asset.

feed.title: SMX reverse split cuts shares; post-split trading on Nov 18, 2025
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) plc announced an 8-for-1 reverse stock split, effective November 18, 2025, consolidating every eight ordinary shares into one. This action reduces the outstanding shares from 8,404,581 to 1,050,572, and post-split trading will commence on Nasdaq under the symbol SMX. Fractional shares will not be issued, and company options and warrants, including SMXWW, will be proportionately adjusted.

feed.title: Why Did SMX Stock Surge 55% In After-Hours Trading?
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC (NASDAQ: SMX) shares surged 55.1% in after-hours trading after signing a non-binding letter of intent with CARTIF for its molecular marking platform and amending its 2022 Incentive Equity Plan. The company also disclosed a prospectus supplement regarding the potential resale of ordinary shares from convertible promissory note conversions. Despite the surge, SMX stock has declined significantly year-to-date and has a negative price trend.

feed.title: Stock Market Today: SPY, QQQ Gain, Futures Trading…
feed.summary: U.S. stock futures trading was halted on Black Friday due to a data center glitch, impacting major indexes and specific stocks like Tilray and Direct Digital, while SPY and QQQ saw premarket gains. Walmart and Apple were highlighted for their holiday shopping strategies, and an analyst provided an optimistic long-term economic outlook despite current consumer debt concerns.

feed.title: Stock Market Today: SPY, QQQ Rise, Commodity Futures Trading Halted Amid Glitch On Black Friday—Apple, Walmart, Security Matters In Focus
feed.summary: On Black Friday, benchmark index tracking ETFs like SPY and QQQ rose despite a data center glitch that halted trading in commodity futures, US Treasuries, and crude oil. Individual stocks like SMX (Security Matters), Walmart, and Apple saw gains due to various corporate news and seasonal promotions, while Tilray Brands and Direct Digital Holdings experienced declines. Analyst insights from Wells Fargo suggest optimism for the economy into 2026, despite current consumer debt concerns.

feed.title: Dubai Is Raising the Bar for Gold and SMX Is Setting It
feed.summary: Dubai is elevating its standards in the gold market, focusing on verified assets and clearer visibility to enhance efficiency and trust. SMX (Security Matters) Plc is positioned to provide the necessary identity technology, creating repeatable authenticity and strengthening every part of the gold workflow from refineries to trading desks. This innovation aims to transform gold into a fully accountable asset, enhancing global trade and market predictability.

feed.title: Goldstrom Partners with SMX to Deliver End-to-End Traceability and Circularity in Precious Metals
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC has partnered with Goldstrom Advisory FZCO through an Advisory Agreement to enhance traceability and circularity in the precious metals industry. Goldstrom will assist in developing SMX's molecular-marker technology and digital product passports for the gold and silver supply chain, aiming for full audit-grade transparency and sustainability. This collaboration is expected to transform the industry by enabling verifiable "memory-enabled" metals, from mining to recycling, ensuring provenance and premium value.

feed.title: SMX Stock (Security Matters, NASDAQ:SMX): Reverse Split Fallout and Global ‘Proof Economy’ Push – 21 November 2025
feed.summary: Security Matters (NASDAQ:SMX) is experiencing extreme volatility following its latest 8:1 reverse stock split on November 18, 2025. Despite its micro-cap status and significant losses, the company is aggressively promoting its molecular identity platform as a critical infrastructure for global trade, national security, and the circular economy, highlighting partnerships and deployments in six countries. The article contrasts SMX's ambitious narrative with its fragile financial reality and repeated reverse splits.

feed.title: SMX Scores Its Sixth 2025 Partnership to Turn "Proof" Into an Asset Class
feed.summary: SMX (NASDAQ: SMX) has secured its sixth partnership in 2025, aiming to establish "proof" as an asset class across various sectors like plastics, precious metals, textiles, and rare earth elements. These collaborations, including with entities in Singapore and Spain, are designed to integrate SMX’s molecular markers and digital passports into supply chains, thereby enhancing traceability, certification, and economic value. The company asserts that these partnerships demonstrate a significant shift from theoretical concepts to practical, market-adopted solutions that address regulatory and sustainability needs.

feed.title: SMX (SMX), CARTIF sign non-binding LOI with 120-day evaluation to integrate traceability in EU
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC and CARTIF, a leading Spanish research center, have signed a non-binding Letter of Intent to evaluate integrating SMX's molecular "physical-to-digital" marking and blockchain analytics into CARTIF's sustainability and Industry 5.0 projects. This 120-day evaluation period aims to accelerate circular economy innovation, initially in Castilla y León, with plans for expansion across Spain and Europe. The collaboration seeks to create a framework for tracking critical materials, authenticating products, and unlocking new funding mechanisms to support a circular economy.

feed.title: SMX And CARTIF To Evaluate Potential Collaboration to Accelerate 'Physical-To-Digital' Circular-Economy Innovation Across Spain & Europe
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC and CARTIF, a leading Spanish non-profit technology research center, are evaluating a collaboration to integrate SMX's molecular marking technology into CARTIF's sustainability projects. This potential partnership aims to accelerate circular economy innovation across Spain and Europe by providing advanced traceability solutions for critical materials and products. The collaboration seeks to shorten lab-to-market pathways, unlock sustainability-linked finance, and foster open innovation across various industrial sectors.

feed.title: Security Matters PLC (NASDAQ: SMX): Turning Waste Into Proof
feed.summary: Security Matters PLC (NASDAQ: SMX) offers technology that embeds physical and chemical markers into materials, combined with readers and a blockchain platform, to provide instant proof of authenticity, provenance, and lifecycle. This innovation supports ESG goals, brand protection, and circular economy initiatives by creating a verifiable material trail from virgin to recycled materials. SMX's collaborations, such as the plastics passport program in Singapore, demonstrate its potential to monetize waste and reshape supply chain verification, offering a significant opportunity for investors in ESG-driven technology.

feed.title: SMX and REDWAVE to Turn Plastic Waste Into a "Plastics Passport", Creating a New Global Asset Class (NASDAQ: SMX)
feed.summary: SMX and REDWAVE are partnering to transform plastic waste into a new global asset class through a "Plastics Passport" system. SMX's sub-molecular markers and blockchain-based digital passports will track plastic throughout its lifecycle, while REDWAVE's industrial sorting systems will integrate this verification at scale. This collaboration aims to monetize verified recycled plastic through the Plastic Cycle Token (PCT), allowing it to be traded in financial markets and creating a premium for sustainable materials.

feed.title: SMX And A*STAR Launch Molecular Tagging System To Transform Singapore's Plastic Waste
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC and Singapore's Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR) have partnered to create a national plastic traceability system. This system will use molecular tagging and blockchain technology to boost recycling rates and reduce incineration in Singapore, aligning with the country’s Zero Waste Masterplan. The initiative aims to track plastics throughout their lifecycle and create economic value by converting plastic waste into a high-value feedstock stream.

feed.title: SMX (Security Matters) Secures $11M in Growth Capital, Pushing 2025 Total Up To $20M
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC announced it secured up to $11 million in convertible note financing from institutional investors, potentially bringing its total capital raised in 2025 to $20 million. This funding will accelerate the expansion of its digital platform for supply chain transparency, build out its digital treasury infrastructure for ESG assets, and strengthen its balance sheet. The financing was secured without warrants, reflecting investor confidence in SMX's long-term strategy and execution.

feed.title: SMX (Security Matters) Secures $11M in Growth Capital, Pushing 2025 Total Up To $20M
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC announced it has secured up to $11 million in convertible note financing, potentially bringing its total capital raised in 2025 to $20 million. This growth capital, raised without warrants, aims to expand SMX's digital platform for supply chain transparency, build out its digital treasury infrastructure for ESG assets, and strengthen its balance sheet. The financing demonstrates institutional investor confidence in SMX's long-term strategy, technology, and execution, especially given challenging microcap market conditions.

feed.title: SMX (Security Matters) Secures $11M in Growth Capital, Pushing 2025 Total Up To $20M
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) PLC announced securing up to $11 million in convertible note financing from institutional investors, potentially bringing their total capital raised in 2025 to $20 million. This funding will accelerate platform expansion for supply chain transparency, build out digital treasury infrastructure for ESG assets, and strengthen the company's balance sheet. The financing was secured without warrants, indicating strong investor alignment with SMX's long-term vision.

feed.title: SMX (Security Matters) to jump 2,200% at the open - about time too
feed.summary: SMX (Security Matters) stock is set to undergo a 2,200% nominal jump due to a 1-for-22 reverse stock split, rather than any actual increase in company value. This comes after a 99% value destruction since its flotation earlier in the year, leading to a breach of NASDAQ listing rules. The company's management has been criticized for focusing on complaining about short-selling instead of improving company performance, despite having seemingly viable technology.

feed.title: SMX Security Matters up 40%, another SPAC IPO with its second wind
feed.summary: SMX Security Matters (NASDAQ: SMX), a company that uses chemicals for product tracking and tracing, experienced a 40% premarket surge, yet its stock performance since its SPAC IPO has been poor, falling from $10 to $1.89. The article discusses why short-selling complaints are viewed negatively and raises concerns about the quality of later SPAC offerings after an initial rush.
